message.content:
1. The statement is discussing post-surgery drug consumption.
2. The drugs being discussed are morphine and tramadol.
3. The statement is comparing drug consumption between a paravertebral group and a control group.
4. Twenty-four hours after surgery, the median cumulative morphine consumption in the paravertebral group was 0 mg.
5. Twenty-four hours after surgery, the 25th–75th percentile cumulative morphine consumption in the paravertebral group was 0–2 mg.
6. Twenty-four hours after surgery, the median cumulative morphine consumption in the control group was 2.5 mg.
7. Twenty-four hours after surgery, the 25th–75th percentile cumulative morphine consumption in the control group was 2–4 mg.
8. The difference in morphine consumption between the two groups was statistically significant (P<0.0001).
9. Twenty-four hours after surgery, the median cumulative tramadol consumption in the paravertebral group was 200 mg.
10. Twenty-four hours after surgery, the 25th–75th percentile cumulative tramadol consumption in the paravertebral group was 150–250 mg.
11. Twenty-four hours after surgery, the median cumulative tramadol consumption in the control group was 300 mg.
12. Twenty-four hours after surgery, the 25th–75th percentile cumulative tramadol consumption in the control group was 200–350 mg.
13. The difference in tramadol consumption between the two groups was statistically significant (P=0.003).

messages.content:
Statement: Twenty-four hours after surgery, median (25th–75th percentile) cumulative morphine consumption was 0 (0–2) vs 2.5 (2–4) mg (P<0.0001) and cumulative tramadol consumption was 200 (150–250) mg vs 300 (200–350) mg in the paravertebral and in the control group, respectively (P=0.003).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
